reviews.review_msg: Lots of readings and difficult to complete since you only had two days to complete it. i found her syllabus to be rather borring she is very informative and easily accessible outside of class. Overall would not take again as it lowered my GPA significantly

She is really nice, approachable and understanding... very willing to help and take suggestions from her students.  She expects good work and prep and encourages discussion.  My only complaint is that sometimes discussions were too narrowed, like she had a certain answer in mind and didn't always allow other discussions/theories fully develop.
A very traditional teacher.  Straight forward, lots of relevant history with the literature.  Fair marker, but wants preparation and decent work.
kind, a renaissance man, honourable and fair
Nicky was so delightful. Funny and she knows what she is talking about. Our class was mostly self marked, and we could choose whether or not to be marked on participation.

Great prof!Sure she is nutty, but she is entertaining,especially for those 4hr night classes.The grading structure is awesome,choose the journal.She is a harder marker than it would seem,but you're an English student do what you're expected to do! :-)

felt a little bit like high school... we don't really get into anything in any depth. Just learn her code (gender analysis) and repeat and apply and you will do fine. Whatever you do, don't question the wisdom of only reading plays this ways, not so generous toward diff't outlook

She is an amazing energetic professor.  She wants her students to succeed and will do anything to see all do so.  Reading is a must because a lot of the marks are based on participation (but hey it's an English class!) Great writing exercises.  I have not learned so much in an university class but it was not painful to do so.
